snippet: Massimino, who rose to fame as the leader of the 1985 Villanova team that won the national championship, now coaches at Keiser University, an N.A.I.A. program in Florida.
abstract: Profile of Roland Vincent Massimino, who rose to fame as coach of 1985 Villanova men's basketball team that won national championship--one of great upsets in college sports history; Massimino more recently created Keiser University Division II program from scratch, leading them to 246-60 record over ten years.
lead_paragraph: Massimino, who rose to fame as the leader of the 1985 Villanova team that won the national championship, now coaches at Keiser University, an N.A.I.A. program in Florida.

headline.main: Rollie Massimino’s Latest Act: A Smaller Stage, but Just as Frenetic
headline.print_headline: Smaller Stage Hasn’t Slowed This Underdog
